intro: Argylia glutinosa, commonly known as the sticky argylia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its glandular hairs that secrete a sticky substance, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange and are clustered in inflorescences. The sticky resin produced by the plant has been used traditionally for various purposes, including as an adhesive and in traditional medicine.
